summary: He squish himself some more  This can be used for stimboard purposes, as long as you credit me. DO NOT USE if you are…[[MORE]] -...
caption:
He squish himself some more


This can be used for stimboard purposes, as long as you credit me.

DO NOT USE if you are…

- Transmisic, queermisic, anti-pansexual, ant-nonbinary, anti-MOGAI, gender-critical, anti-neopronouns, anything of that sort

- Truscum/transmed, “neutral on the subject,” or “truscute”

- Exclusionist or “neutral on the subject”

- Anti-anti

- Pedophile or okay with pedophiles

- Zoophile or okay with zoophiles

- Anti-feminist, anti-choice, etc

- Anti-kin, anti-otherkin

- TERF, radfem, racist, sexist, exorsexist, classist, fatmisic

- “Neutral” on any of the above subjects

blog.name: theadubclub
blog.title: The A-Dub Club!
blog.description: The A-Dub Club is a podcast hosted by Alex Wade and Andrew Whipple where they tackle the big questions in science fiction, fantasy, technology, pop culture, and general nerdery. If you have questions for the club, send them to theawclub@gmail.com or on Twitter @TheAwClub

title: Pikachu Is Daddy
body:
The question: What did you think of Pokemon: Detective Pikachu?

As always, we discuss lots of stuff and sometimes we spoil it. This time, discussions include:

  • The movie Pokemon: Detective Pikachu

Download the mp3

Not sure where to start with the pod? Try our topics guide to find an episode to listen to!

Be our friend!

tags: apparently rita ora was in this? ok
title: Pokemon: Detective Pikachu (2019)
body:
Date watched: 15 June 2019

All right.

Setting aside the fact that I haven’t seen a Pokemon cartoon since the 90s, that I was not into Pokemon Go, that I haven’t really thought about anything Pokemon-related in over 20 years AND not forgetting the fact that I famously am completely underwhelmed by anything Ryan Reynolds has done in the past or will do in the future and by Ryan Reynolds himself – I didn’t hate this, but I also didn’t think it was particularly good.

Maybe if you’re a die-hard Pokemon fan, there are probably a lot of Easter Eggs and things in here that I just wasn’t picking up on.  I have only the vaguest recollection of what Pokemon is about, but I did recognise Jiggly Puff instantly, as I remember that Jiggly Puff was my favourite, but I couldn’t exactly tell you why.

Does Jiggly Puff sing the song and then get really mad and blow up?  I mean, if that’s the case then I identify with that on a fundamental level.

I mean, I didn’t hate this.  The animation was great.  Pikachu is just the most fucking adorable, huggable, squishable thing ever – that was the most preposterous part for me, because like, if I had that fluffy yellow squishy bastard following me around I’d just be hugging it nonstop, and Justice Smith wanted pretty much nothing to do with it and I’m like DUDE.

Like, I want a Pikachu of my own, is what this movie made me feel.

I’m not going to get into the plot as the movie is only relatively new and therefore spoilers, but I am going to talk about the ending under the cut:

All right so Bill Nighy’s evil scheme is to combine humans and Pokemon so they’re one thing, right?  And he achieves that by putting Ryan Reynolds in Pikachu’s body, and it turns out that the talking Pikachu was Justice Smith’s father all along.

And I was just like… that’s a HARD eye roll from me, guys.

I know to get around this they were like, oh Pikachu has amnesia, but like… you mean to tell me that Justice Smith couldn’t recognise his father’s voice?  For this whole movie Ryan Reynolds has been talking to his SON and Justice Smith didn’t recognise his VOICE?

Look, I think of it this way.  My grandfather has been dead for nearly 12 years, right?  If my grandfather was suddenly talking to me in the form of a Pokemon, I would still RECOGNISE HIS VOICE.

I know in the grand scheme of things that this does not really matter, but fuck it annoyed me so much.  And honestly, I think it’s because Ryan Reynolds annoys the ever-loving fuck out of me in real life and I should know better by now than to watch his movies, but how can I resist a cute, fluffy, squishy Pikachu?  I’m only human.

[[MORE]]

Maybe if you’re a die-hard Pokemon fan, there are probably a lot of Easter Eggs and things in here that I just wasn’t picking up on.  I have only the vaguest recollection of what Pokemon is about, but I did recognise Jiggly Puff instantly, as I remember that Jiggly Puff was my favourite, but I couldn’t exactly tell you why.

Does Jiggly Puff sing the song and then get really mad and blow up?  I mean, if that’s the case then I identify with that on a fundamental level.

I mean, I didn’t hate this.  The animation was great.  Pikachu is just the most fucking adorable, huggable, squishable thing ever – that was the most preposterous part for me, because like, if I had that fluffy yellow squishy bastard following me around I’d just be hugging it nonstop, and Justice Smith wanted pretty much nothing to do with it and I’m like DUDE.

Like, I want a Pikachu of my own, is what this movie made me feel.

I’m not going to get into the plot as the movie is only relatively new and therefore spoilers, but I am going to talk about the ending under the cut:
